comment: You may be underestimating the number of people whose main concern is the unnecessary suffering, not the killing itself. For pagans, the complete lack of contact with the living and dying animal may be an extra reason. There is nothing "traditional" about factory farming. I would even say it's antithetical to whatever one may mean by "Aryanism".

comment: I think some very unusual diets are possible. Inedia appears in the Polarian mythology and the Aryan Titan mythology. However, in the Kali Yuga, we have cardboard versions of mythological diets. The Hindu don't eat cow in order to signal virtuousness, rather than just not needing to eat it because of being virtuous.Same with vegans; it's an act of sorts.
